Node.definition: = man; ◄ son of Jesse (יִשַׁי) ► king of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)

= the meaning of this word is uncertain and can only be deduced from its etymology; possible interpretations include: a song that shows understanding, by which the understanding either refers to the structure or to the contents of this song; or: a song that gives understanding; or: a meditation
= state of being considered fortunate and blessed by God; ≈ accompanied by an attitude of admiration
literally: to bear; hence: = action by which humans or deities let go of any anger or resentment with regard to the wrongdoing or sin of (other) humans
= action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression
literally: to cover; hence: = action by which humans or deities no longer hold (other) humans responsible for certain actions
= state in which a human being is responsible for a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether committed on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
= state of being considered fortunate and blessed by God; ≈ accompanied by an attitude of admiration
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

Node.gloss: to consider someone guilty of something|to credit someone for something
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities hold the opinion that an event or situation is to be considered a particular person's responsibility
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= inner person of a human or celestial being, associated with emotions, such as joy, grief, worry, courage, anger, willingness, etc.
= the state in which something false is described or spoken about as true, so that others believe it to be truth
= action by which someone purposely refrains from responding, either with words or with actions

Node.gloss: to wear out|to become worn out|to waste away
Node.definition: = process by which objects lose their quality and strength due to continued use; ≈ used figuratively to denote the loss of a person's vitality
literally: bones; hence: = the physical body of a human being
= action by which animals, humans, or deities produce a full, deep, prolonged sound as made by a lion
literally: all the day; hence: = process by which an event or pattern of events takes place for an extended time, without interruption
= during the daytime
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship
literally: (someone's) hand is heavy (against someone else); hence: = action by which a deity is chastising humans
literally: hand; hence: = process by which humans or deties engage in an act of violence against (other) humans
= process by which events take on a different nature
= state in which humans have physical strength
= extended period of dry weather, often with high temperatures, ► which may result in a shortage of water

= hot season of the year, opposite of חֹרֶף (חֹרֶף) ► time when most crops are harvested and preparations are made for the cold season; ≈ sometimes associated with excessive heat and drought, and also with hard work
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution

Node.gloss: to make known|to show|to inform|to tell|to teach
Node.definition: = causative process by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to acquire information about (other) humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
literally: to cover (information); hence: = causative action by which humans or deities keep certain information hidden from others

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= action by which humans publicly admit their own shortcomings before God, or the shortcomings of the people they represent
= action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
literally: to bear; hence: = action by which humans or deities let go of any anger or resentment with regard to the wrongdoing or sin of (other) humans
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution

= someone who practices חֶסֶד, who is committed towards fulfilling his/her obligations; these may be obligations defined within the context of a covenant or agreement, or moral obligations to do well to someone who did well to you before
= a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time
= process by which humans on a spiritual journey find God
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency
literally: to touch; hence: = process or action by which humans or substances arrive at a certain location
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= state in which people, animals, or objects are in a location where they cannot be readily seen or where danger cannot reach them
= a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape

Node.gloss: to watch over|to guard|to be in charge of|to take care of|to protect|to tend|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities make sure that an object is safe from harm; ◄ by observing the object and the surrounding area carefully and intervening when necessary

Node.gloss: to surround (someone with something)|to cause (something) to happen in full measure
Node.definition: literally: to surround (someone with an an activity); hence: = causative process by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to undergo a certain activity in full measure

Node.gloss: to make wise|to give understanding|to instruct
Node.definition: = causative action or process by which humans, deities, or plants cause humans to have the ability to understand things
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to acquire knowledge, a skill, or a certain type of behavior
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= process by which humans or deities follow a certain pattern of behavior, ◄ which is described as their journey through life
= action by which humans or deities give information to others to help them exercise their minds to determine how they are going to achieve a particular purpose

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= large domesticated solid hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot

= male or female offspring of a male donkey and a female horse (or, but less common, a male horse and a female donkey); stronger than a donkey and more resistant to diseases than horses and donkeys; infertile; usually dark brown in color; has bigger ears than the parent horse; ► used for riding and as pack animals; ≈ associated with a lack of understanding

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant

Node.gloss: to consider|to pay heed|to perceive|to realize|to understand|to distinguish
Node.definition: = process by which someone gains knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

= short bar, ◄ usually made of metal, ► placed in the mouth of a horse; its ends, which project from the mouth of the animal, are attached to ropes or leather straps that fit over the head as the bridle (רֶסֶן) used to steer the horse; ≈ associated with control and, indirectly, with lack of wisdom
= set of ropes or leather straps; ► fitted over the head of a horse and connected to the bit (מֶתֶג) used to steer the horse
= action by which someone establishes control over an animal; ► in order to restrain its movements
= particle marking a proposition as not true

Node.gloss: to approach|to come near|to come forward
Node.definition: = action by which humans or animals move to a location relatively close to the location in focus
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency
literally: wound; hence: = state in which humans experience a deep sense of grief, ◄ as if wounded in spirit
= state in which humans have confidence in someone or something else and show that by their actions; ≈ usually regarded as negative when the object is human, always positive when the object is YHWH
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

Node.gloss: to be surrounded (with something)|to happen in full measure
Node.definition: literally: (an activity) surrounds (someone); hence: = process by which humans undergo a certain activity in full measure
= state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
mainly in poetical texts: = state in which humans feel and show great joy
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= person whose behavior is morally and ethically right
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
